intro: Tribulus ochroleucus var. perplexans, commonly known as the yellow-leafed tribulus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low water availability, showcasing drought-resistant traits. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
